title: Just when i forgot why i hated URF
body:
No, not because of all the annoying URF fans who act entitled, not because it's not a fun and unique concept.
Because of how the community is taking it so seriously.
Literally the first game i played i was flamed for picking jhin, our midlaner left the game at 10 min because our shaco went double top instead of jungle, and my botlane partner flamed me and left to midlane because i didnt pick a "meta" pick.
And here is the problem - meta.
We have enough of that in normal SR, these game modes are supposed to be fun and special, not a try hard competetive mode where you need to spam OP picks.
Seriously, i gurantee almost every game will have an ez, lux, nidalee, hecarim, and you know the rest.

So please, URF was fun when peopled explored and did silly things, dont ruin the URF spirit and have casual, none serious fun. It's only here for a weekend.

No, that's not it, people love throwing the problems of a mode on the community but that's just not the case.

This is a standard prisoners dilemma, with the standard result: everyone suffers.

Because here's the thing, you blame your teammates, but they aren't the issue, they are a reflection of the mode.

You got into a game, you pick jhin, your teammates also pick subpar picks and nobody flames anyone, then you get into a game and the enemy team is filled with op shit, sona, katarina, zed, fizz, pick your poison, you get shitstomped, they aren't better, they aren't playing better, their champs are just bs and you aren't having any fun, flamed by teammates or not, so you go into your next game and this time you're the one picking op shit because you don't want the previous game to repeat itself, and then any opponents who didn't pick BS champs get frustrated, and learn their lesson for their next game.

The cycle continues until eventually everyone is just abusing broken picks to avoid being abused themselves, that's the natural outcome of such a situation and the fault is with the mode itself, NOT the players, the only reason urf was fun first time it came was because people were trying to figure out the op picks, that's it.

So no, it's not to community, it is in fact the mode which is shit.

It is the community, it's the community who creates the meta,  yea, some champions are fun AND very strong, but most are just abnoxious spam Q over and over in a general direction.
I remember last year i had a blast with AP rek'sai, just sending void missiles and doing tons of damage.
I remember AP nasus just flaming the whole map.
But because it's been out twice in 2 years, people already know the best champions, and people dont realise a meta was created, and without thinking just spam "BRING URF BACK BRING URF BACK".
